formdata.value:
- Transcribe provided audio accurately.
- Preserve natural flow of the speaker/singer.
- Include speaker labels (e.g., Speaker 1, Speaker 2) if more than one person is talking.
- If unclear words appear, mark them as [inaudible] or [unclear].
- Detect and note the spoken language(s).
- Briefly describe tone (formal, conversational, emotional, musical, instructional, etc.).
- If it’s a meeting, interview, or discussion: provide a concise summary and list of decisions, next steps, or action points.
- If it’s a lecture, training, or educational audio: outline key topics, concepts, and learning takeaways.
- If it’s a song, poem, or prayer: provide transliteration (if non-English) and an English interpretation maintaining cultural and poetic accuracy.

item.name: HA1a - User story to Non functional Test cases

body.raw:
{
"model": {{textModel}},
"messages": [{
    "role": "user",
    "content": "You are an AI assistant acting as a Senior QA Engineer with 15 years of experience in non-functional testing. Your task is to generate a comprehensive suite of non-functional test cases (covering Performance, Scalability, Security, and Accessibility) based on the provided user story.

Instructions:
- Analyze the user story’s functionality, data volume, and user interaction to identify risks across key quality attributes.
- Generate only test cases if the user story impacts non-functional behavior (e.g., file uploads, system load, data handling).
- Each test case must include: Test Category, Specific Attribute, Test Case ID, Test Case Description & Scenario, Test Steps / Conditions, and Success Criteria / Pass-Fail Metric.
- Include measurable thresholds (e.g., response time < 2s, concurrency ≥ 25 users, file size ≤ 950 MB).
- Prioritize high-impact, realistic, and context-aware scenarios that can be executed within a 4-week testing cycle.
- For Performance testing, address: peak user concurrency, response time thresholds, resource utilization (CPU/memory), and degradation behavior under overload.
- For Security testing, cover: input validation, authentication enforcement, and prevention of sensitive data exposure.
- Output must be strictly limited to the structured test cases and a brief summary—no explanations, disclaimers, or extra text.

Output Format:
{
 summary:<brief risk-focused analysis of the user story>,
 test_cases: [
 {
 test_category: Performance|Scalability|Security|Accessibility,
 specific_attribute: e.g., Load Testing, Input Validation,
 test_case_id: e.g., PERF-UPLOAD-01,
 description: Clear scenario description,
 test_steps: concrete, executable steps
 success_criteria: Measurable pass/fail metric with thresholds
 },
 ...
 ]
}

User Story:
Background We have just published a new edition of this standard, AS 1742.2:2022, which contains a very large number of image files. 666 in total and this is likely to be the largest we need to handle.

And when tried to load the zip containing the .eps format images - it failed giving the error message below 

The Source zip file is 191 MB 

Scope - NISO Phase SIM user interface no impact on HAPI

Acceptance Criteria

Given NISO Phase I SIM allows upload of zip folders as binary attachments

When the SIM Librarian clicks the option to Upload New File

Then

NISO Phase I SIM should allow upload of zip files up to 950 MB

If you need the real zip for testing - please contact Renata Plisek 

Test

Upload zip folders of 120 MB, 150 MB and 200 MB to verify that SIM can support expected user operations without disruption"
    }]
}

exec: // Try to find the array of records in the response
// Try to parse CSV from content if present
// Try to parse as CSV if possible
// Helper to parse CSV string into array of objects

body.raw:
{
  "model": "openai/gpt-oss-120b",
  "messages": [
    {
      "role": "user",
      "content": "Instructions
- Generate 20 records  of synthetic credit card test data.
- [CRITICAL] All data must be FAKE and unusable for real transactions
- [MANDATORY] Use realistic but fictional names and addresses
- Include both India and international formats
- Generate 20-30 test cases covering edge cases
- Include major card networks with correct IIN ranges:
   - Visa: 4xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx (13-19 digits)
   - Mastercard: 51xxxx-55xxxx, 2221xx-2720xx (16 digits)
   - American Express: 34xxxx, 37xxxx (15 digits)
- CoveR follOWing card varieties
   - Valid cards with future expiration dates
   - Expired cards (past expiration)
   - Specific test card numbers that trigger gateway responses
   - Various security code formats (3-digit for most, 4-digit for Amex)
   - Different cardholder name formats
   - International billing addresses

Context
You are a PCI-DSS compliant test data generator specializing in creating realistic but 100% fake credit card information for software testing purposes.
Generate comprehensive credit card test data that includes various card types, status conditions, and formatting scenarios for testing payment systems.

Example
card_number,expiration_date,cvv,cardholder_name,card_type,billing_zip,test_scenario,expected_gateway_response
4111111111111111,12/28,123,John Smith,Visa,94105,valid_visa,approved
5105105105105100,06/25,456,Maria Garcia,Mastercard,10001,valid_mastercard,approved
378282246310005,08/24,3456,Robert Johnson,American Express,90210,valid_amex,approved

Output
Generate in CSV format with these columns:
- card_number
- expiration_date (MM/YY)
- cvv
- cardholder_name
- card_type
- billing_zip
- test_scenario
- expected_gateway_response"
    },
    {
      "role": "system",
      "content": "As an AI Assistant give me test data in a table format"
    },
    {
      "role": "assistant",
      "content": "only Java selenium code should be displayed along with the comments"
    }
  ]
}
